Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, a drawing in black ink of the god Amun-Ra-Horakhty holding a 'was'-sceptre in his right hand and an 'ankh'-sign in his left hand, and at his feet a line of hieroglyphic text mentioning the author of the sketch: the draughtsman Nebnefer and his son, the draughtsman Hori. Above the 'was'-sceptre is a cartouche with an unintelligible name. Behind the figure of the god is one vertical line of hieroglyphic text.
Curator's comments: The draughtsman Nebnefer is well known, together with his brothers Hormin and Amenwa as sons of the draughtsman Hori (also the name of his grandson), from the later years of Ramses III till the reign of Ramses VI; cf. B.G. Davies, 'Who's Who at Deir el-Medina' (Leiden, 1999). pp. 168—74. For other ostraca signed by this Nebnefer cf. O. Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge, EGA 4324-1943 verso (E. Brunner-Traut, 'Egyptian Artists' Sketches' (Istanbul, 1979), pp. 76-7 and pl. XXXVIII), and O. Cairo 25120 (G. Daressy, 'Ostraca' (Cairo 1901), p. 23 and pl. XXII).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393029) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393029)
